metadata.title: CVE-2021-33829 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor inCKEditor 4 4.14.0 through 4.16.x before 4.16.1 allows remote attackers toinject executable JavaScript code through a crafted comment because --!> ismishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.5.7+dfsg-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.7+dfsg-2ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm1').
